result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L Tolle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
23 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
21CF1335 dismissed and read in.
Concurrent with: with 21CF856 and 21CF1343

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No contact with J.M. or her residence.
No contact with Walmart stores.
Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Pur. 973.015, record to be expunged upon successful completion of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Tolle

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.

(Cases called at 2:53 PM - 21CF856, 21CF1335, 21CF1343, 22CF40)
Defendant Justin Tolle appears in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail via videoconference.  Attorney Zebulon Patek appears in the courtroom.  Attorney Robert Stoiber appears for the State of Wisconsin in the courtroom.
Defense outlines the agreement for the Court.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant advised of the elements and maximum possible penalties of the offenses to which he will plea.  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights.  Court finds Defendant guilty based on pleas of No Contest to 21CF856 Count 1: Felony Retail Theft; 21CF1343 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping (Domestic Abuse); 22CF40 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping (Domestic Abuse).  Remaining charges and all of case 21CF1335 are dismissed and read in.  Court withholds sentence and orders 24 months of probation with the following conditions: 75 days in jail (with Huber) on 21CF1343 all stayed pending further order of the Court.  No contact with J.M. or her residence.  No contact with Walmart stores.  Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.  Defendant eligible for expungement if probation is successfully completed.  Sentence credit if revoked ordered in the following amounts: 3 days in 21CF856; 53 days in 21CF1343; and 23 days in 22CF40.

(8:23 AM cases 21CF856, 21CF1335, 21CF1343, 22CF40 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Justin L Tolle appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared in court for Justin L Tolle. 
Defendant waives reading of Information in cases 21CF1335, 22CF40 and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts, which the court receives.
State advises there is victim witness issues with 22CF40. Victim Witness is working on reaching the victim to provide proper notification.
Court orders this is adjourned to 2:45 pm today (02/04/2022) to allow for victim notification and possibly resolve the case.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 10:07 AM: 21CF856, 21CF1335, 21CF1343, 22CF40.
Defendant Justin L Tolle appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Kate Cook appeared in court for Justin L Tolle, Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CF1343: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
22CF40:Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.  
STC: 2/4/22 at 8:50 AM.

(11:05 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin L Tolle appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video from the Eau Claire County Jail for Justin L Tolle. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $2,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defense requests bond from defendant's other files apply to this case.
Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions from other file of 21CF1343 applies.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on January 26, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.M.
No contact with J.W.-M., her child or not to be within a mile of her residence or her employment.
(Covers 22CF40, 21CF1343)
